intro: Calycorectes guyanensis, commonly known as the Guyana calycorectes, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in swampy or wetland areas. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and ecological adaptations.
